Detailed Description

Definitions for PPU-side barrier operations.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_BARRIER_EA ( barrier_var   )     ((ctk_barrier_ea_t)(unsigned long)(&(barrier_var)))

A macro to get a barrier reference for the given barrier variable.

Parameters:
[in] barrier_var - a barrier variable (ctk_barrier_t)

#define CTK_BARRIER_PTR ( barrier_ea   )     ((ctk_barrier_t*)(unsigned long)(barrier_ea))

A macro to get a pointer to the barrier variable from the given barrier reference.

Parameters:
[in] barrier_ea - a barrier reference (ctk_barrier_ea_t)

#define CTK_BARRIER_VAR ( barrier_ea   )     (*(ctk_barrier_t*)(unsigned long)(barrier_ea))

A macro to get a barrier variable from the given barrier reference.

Parameters:
[in] barrier_ea - a barrier reference (ctk_barrier_ea_t)

Typedef Documentation

typedef ea_addr_t ctk_barrier_ea_t

barrier reference type

Function Documentation

int ctk_barrier_create ( ctk_barrier_ea_t *  barrier,
unsigned int  count 
)

Creates and initializes a new barrier reference. A new barrier is allocated (by ctk_sync_alloc) and its reference is returned. (You can also directly declares a ctk_barrier_t static variable and gets a reference for it using CTK_BARRIER_EA macro.)

Parameters:
[out] barrier - a created barrier reference.
[in] count - the number of threads that must call ctk_barrier_wait before any of them successfully return from the call.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno otherwise.

void ctk_barrier_destroy ( ctk_barrier_ea_t  barrier  ) 

Destroys the given barrier reference. Cond-var references created by ctk_barrier_create must be destroyed by this routine.

Parameters:
[in] barrier - a barrier reference to be destroyed.

int ctk_barrier_init ( ctk_barrier_ea_t  barrier,
unsigned int  count 
)

Initializes the given barrier.

Parameters:
[in,out] barrier - barrier to be initialized.
[in] value - initial value for the barrier.
[in] count - the number of threads that must call ctk_barrier_wait before any of them successfully return from the call.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno otherwise.

int ctk_barrier_wait ( ctk_barrier_ea_t  barrier  ) 

Blocks until all the participating threads at the barrier have called ctk_barrier_wait.

Parameters:
[in] barrier - the barrier reference
